alert.note: Alert for Covington; Crenshaw (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 05 at 3:00PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Crenshaw and northeastern Covington Counties through 345 PM CDT... At 300 PM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm 8 miles southeast of Dozier, or 9 miles north of Opp, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of south central Crenshaw and northeastern Covington Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
